title: Twisted Hilbert spaces defined by bi-Lipschitz maps
authors: Willian Corr\^ea, Sheldon Dantas, Daniel L. Rodr\'iguez-Vidanes
abstract:
We obtain an infinite-dimensional cone of singular twisted Hilbert spaces
$Z(\varphi)$ which are isomorphic to their duals but not to their conjugate
duals. We do that by showing that the subset of all bi-Lipschitz maps from $[0,
\infty)$ to $\mathbb{R}$ is coneable. We also provide a characterization of the
Kalton-Peck space among all twisted Hilbert spaces of the form $Z(\varphi)$,
which gives a partial answer to a conjecture of F. Cabello S\'anchez and J.
Castillo.
